brief_summary.textblock:
This is a research study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and anti-viral activity of
      sofosbuvir with ribavirin in Egyptian adults with genotype 4 hepatitis C infection.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sofosbuvir Plus Ribavirin Administered for Either 12 or 24 Weeks in Treatment-Naïve and Treatment-Experienced Egyptian Adults With Chronic Genotype 4 Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Infection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Treatment experienced and naïve subjects

          -  Chronic genotype 4 HCV-infection

          -  Not co-infected with HIV

          -  Screening laboratory values within defined thresholds

          -  Use of highly effective contraception methods

          -  Subject must be able to comply with the dosing instructions for study drug
             administration and able to complete the study schedule of assessments.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  History of any other clinically significant chronic liver disease

          -  Pregnant or nursing female or male with pregnant female partner

          -  History of clinically-significant illness or any other major medical disorder that
             may interfere with subject treatment, assessment or compliance with the protocol

          -  Excessive alcohol ingestion or significant drug abuse

intervention.description: Sofosbuvir 400 mg tablet administered orally once daily
Ribavirin (RBV) 200 mb tablets administered orally in a divided daily dose according to package insert weight-based dosing recommendations (< 75kg = 1000 mg and ≥ 75 kg = 1200 mg)

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Open-Label, Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Sofosbuvir Plus Ribavirin Administered for Either 12 or 24 Weeks in Treatment-Naïve and Treatment-Experienced Egyptian Adults With Chronic Genotype 4 HCV Infection.

oversight_info.authority: Egypt: Ministry of Health and Population

primary_outcome.description: SVR12 is defined as HCV RNA < the lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ) 12 weeks following the last dose of study drug.
primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with sustained virologic response 12 weeks after discontinuation of treatment (SVR12)
Any adverse event leading to permanent discontinuation of study drug(s)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: SVR4 and SVR24 is defined as HCV RNA < the lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ) 4 weeks and 24 weeks following the last dose of study drug, respectively.
secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with sustained virologic response at 4 and 24 weeks after discontinuation of treatment (SVR4 and SVR24)

secondary_outcome.description:
On-treatment virologic failure is defined as either:
Breakthrough: HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ after having previously had HCV RNA < LLOQ, while on treatment, confirmed with 2 consecutive values (note: second confirmation value can be posttreatment), or last available on-treatment measurement with no subsequent follow up values , or
Rebound: > 1 log10IU/mL increase in HCV RNA from nadir while on treatment, confirmed with 2 consecutive values (note: second confirmation value can be posttreatment), or last available on-treatment measurement with no subsequent follow up values, or
Nonresponse: HCV RNA persistently ≥ LLOQ through 8 weeks of treatment
secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with on-treatment virologic failure

secondary_outcome.description: Relapse is defined as having HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ during the posttreatment period having achieved HCV RNA < LLOQ at end of treatment.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
